001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.buffer;
002
003import java.util.ArrayDeque;
004import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
005
006/**
007 * Simple bounded pool of reusable byte arrays to minimize temporary allocations in IO hot paths.
008 */
009public final class BufferPool {
010  private final int bufferSize;
011  private final int maxPoolSize;
012  private final ArrayDeque<byte[]> pool;
013  private final ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();
014
015  /**
016   * Creates a buffer pool with the desired buffer size and maximum cached entries.
017   *
018   * @param bufferSize size of each pooled buffer in bytes
019   * @param maxPoolSize maximum number of buffers kept in the pool
020   */
021  public BufferPool(int bufferSize, int maxPoolSize) {
022    if (bufferSize <= 0) {
023      throw new IllegalArgumentException("bufferSize must be positive");
024    }
025    if (maxPoolSize <= 0) {
026      throw new IllegalArgumentException("maxPoolSize must be positive");
027    }
028    this.bufferSize = bufferSize;
029    this.maxPoolSize = maxPoolSize;
030    this.pool = new ArrayDeque<>(maxPoolSize);
031  }
032
033  /**
034   * Borrows a buffer from the pool, creating one when the pool is empty.
035   */
036  public PooledBuffer acquire() {
037    byte[] data;
038    lock.lock();
039    try {
040      data = pool.pollFirst();
041    } finally {
042      lock.unlock();
043    }
044    if (data == null) {
045      data = new byte[bufferSize];
046    }
047    return new PooledBuffer(this, data);
048  }
049
050  void release(byte[] data) {
051    if (data == null || data.length != bufferSize) {
052      return;
053    }
054    lock.lock();
055    try {
056      if (pool.size() < maxPoolSize) {
057        pool.addFirst(data);
058      }
059    } finally {
060      lock.unlock();
061    }
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Encapsulates a borrowed buffer and returns it to the pool when closed.
066   */
067  public static final class PooledBuffer implements AutoCloseable {
068    private final BufferPool owner;
069    private byte[] data;
070    private boolean released;
071
072    private PooledBuffer(BufferPool owner, byte[] data) {
073      this.owner = owner;
074      this.data = data;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Exposes the currently borrowed buffer; callers must not retain it after closing.
079     *
080     * @return active backing array
081     */
082    public byte[] array() {
083      if (released) {
084        throw new IllegalStateException("buffer already released");
085      }
086      return data;
087    }
088
089    @Override
090    public void close() {
091      if (released) {
092        return;
093      }
094      owner.release(data);
095      released = true;
096      data = null;
097    }
098  }
099}
